title: Motion & Kinematics Assessment Exam
description: Comprehensive assessment of motion and kinematic concepts

questions.question: A vehicle traveling at $30 \text{ m/s}$ decelerates uniformly at $5 \text{ m/s}^2$. How long does it take to stop?
questions.explanation: Using $v_f = v_i + at$: $0 = 30 + (-5)t$, so $5t = 30$ and $t = 6 \text{ s}$

questions.question: A stone is thrown downward from a 125 m tall building with an initial velocity of $10 \text{ m/s}$. How long does it take to reach the ground? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Using $\Delta x = v_i t + \frac{1}{2}at^2$: $125 = 10t + \frac{1}{2}(10)t^2 = 10t + 5t^2$. Solving: $5t^2 + 10t - 125 = 0$, or $t^2 + 2t - 25 = 0$. Using the quadratic formula: $t = \frac{-2 + \sqrt{4 + 100}}{2} = \frac{-2 + 10.2}{2} \approx 5 \text{ s}$ (taking positive root)

questions.question: The area under a velocity-time graph represents displacement.
questions.explanation: The area under a velocity-time graph equals $\int v \, dt = \Delta x$, which is the displacement.

questions.question: An object accelerates from $8 \text{ m/s}$ to $18 \text{ m/s}$ in 5 seconds. What distance does it cover?
An object moving with constant negative acceleration is _______ down.
questions.explanation: Negative acceleration (when velocity is positive) means the object is slowing down or decelerating.

questions.question: A rocket accelerates from rest at $25 \text{ m/s}^2$ for 4 seconds. What is the final velocity?
If an object's velocity-time graph is a horizontal line, the object is accelerating.
questions.explanation: A horizontal line on a velocity-time graph means velocity is constant, so acceleration is zero.

questions.question: A car travels at $20 \text{ m/s}$ and accelerates at $4 \text{ m/s}^2$ for 50 m. What is its final velocity?
questions.explanation: Using $v_f^2 = v_i^2 + 2a\Delta x$: $v_f^2 = (20)^2 + 2(4)(50) = 400 + 400 = 800$, so $v_f = \sqrt{800} \approx 28.3 \text{ m/s}$. The exact answer is $20\sqrt{2} \approx 28.3 \text{ m/s}$, but $30 \text{ m/s}$ is accepted as a rounded answer.
